channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: National Road Safety Week
item.description:
Sunday, May 14, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support National Road Safety Week.

National Road Safety Week (NRSW) aims to remember 1200 people killed on Australian roads each year in road crashes. The week aims to encourage people to take a pledge to drive so others survive and to wear a yellow ribbon to remember those lost to road trauma. Each year, national landmarks are lit yellow around the country to show their support for NRSW. Lit landmarks aim to reinforce the theme "everyone has the right to get home safe".

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Transport and Main Roads

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Light the Way
item.description:
Monday, May 15, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to support Light the Way.

TSA (Tuberous Sclerosis Australia) is wanting to raise awareness by shining a light on May 15 to continue to please help shine a light on the devastating rare disease, TSC (Tuberous Sclerosis Complex). We are reaching out to you today to invite you to “Light the Way” for children, adults and families impacted by the devastating rare disease TSC (Tuberous Sclerosis Complex).

This Light Up is organised by: Tuberous Sclerosis Australia Inc.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: National Volunteer Week
item.description:
Monday, May 15, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red to support National Volunteer Week.

National Volunteer Week is the premier event which recognises and honours the essential and valuable work and the volunteer-involving organisations that engage them to support the achievement of their purpose and mission. Volunteering Queensland,alongside Volunteering Australia and the other state peak bodies lead the nation in celebrating the important work of volunteers across the country.

This Light Up is organised by: Volunteering Queensland

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of WOW Day
item.description:
Tuesday, May 16, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Orange to support Eve of WOW Day.

Wear Orange Wednesday, or WOW Day is the national day to celebrate and thank SES volunteers. It takes place annually on the Wednesday of National Volunteer Week, this year taking place on Wednesday 17 May 2023. In honour of this day, we take the time to thank our Queensland SES volunteers for their dedication and tireless devotion to their communities.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland State Emergency Services Volunteer Association Inc

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: IDAHOBIT
item.description:
Wednesday, May 17, 2023

City Hall will be lit Rainbow to support IDAHOBIT.

Brisbane City Council - River City Pride  wants to light up Brisbane in celebration and awareness of IDAHOBIT Day 2023.  On May 17, 1990 - the World Health Organization removed homosexuality from the Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems. While we celebrate this milestone and other advancements in LGBTQIA+ equality, the unfortunate reality is that there's still more work to do.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council - River City Pride

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Australian Heavy Vehicle Industry Week
item.description:
Thursday, May 18, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue, Yellow and Green to support Australian Heavy Vehicle Industry Week.

Australian Heavy Vehicle Industry (AHVI) Week focuses on promoting the heavy vehicle industry’s values around a set of key themes: safety, innovation, sustainability, careers, knowledge and community. One of its goals it to foster broader community awareness about the heavy vehicle industry’s vital role and positive impact within the community.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: National Palliative Care Week
item.description:
Tuesday, May 23, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Maroon and Blue to support National Palliative Care Week.

National Palliative Care Week (21-27 May 2023) raises awareness for the palliative care sector which helps people with life-limiting illnesses to live as well as possible, for as long as possible – supporting their physical, emotional, spiritual, and social needs. This year’s theme is 'It's Your Right’ and seeks to raise awareness about the rights of all Australians to access high-quality palliative care when and where they need it.

This Light Up is organised by: Palliative Care Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

This year’s theme is 'It's Your Right’ and seeks to raise awareness about the rights of all Australians to access high-quality palliative care when and where they need it.
This Light Up is organised by: Palliative Care Queensland

item.title: Green Heart Fair
item.description:
Wednesday, May 24, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to celebrate Green Heart Fair.

The Green Heart Fair is Brisbane’s favourite free sustainable living event delivered by Brisbane Sustainability Agency on behalf of Brisbane City Council (Council) and the Lord Mayor. The Green Heart Fair is held each year in May at Victoria Park with the purpose of raising awareness around sustainability, promoting Council’s commitment to a clean and green Brisbane and to assist Brisbane residents in making changes to live more sustainably.

This Light Up is organised by: Sustainabilty Brisbane

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

City Hall will be lit Maroon to support National Palliative Care Week.

National Palliative Care Week (21-27 May 2023) raises awareness for the palliative care sector which helps people with life-limiting illnesses to live as well as possible, for as long as possible – supporting their physical, emotional, spiritual, and social needs. This year’s theme is 'It's Your Right’ and seeks to raise awareness about the rights of all Australians to access high-quality palliative care when and where they need it.

This Light Up is organised by: Palliative Care Queensland

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.description:
Thursday, May 25, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Australia's Biggest Morning Tea.

Australia’s Biggest Morning Tea (ABMT) is an opportunity for people to. come together with family, friends and work mates to put on a morning tea, share a cuppa, and help raise vital funds for those affected by cancer.

item.description:

item.title: 2023 LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day
item.description:
Saturday, May 27, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red,Blue,Green,Purple, Orange & Yellow to support 2023 LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day.

The LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation supports LGBTQ victims and survivors of domestic violence and abuse through awareness, education and breaking down barriers to accessing help. The Annual LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day aims to help to end violence and abuse within LGBTQ communities by increasing visibility and understanding, and giving hope and courage to victims and survivors.

This Light Up is organised by: LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: National Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Sunday, May 28, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Flag Colours to recognise National Reconciliation Week.

This year's theme "Be a Voice for Generations". Acknowledges a significant date in the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Community and is a time for all Australians to learn about our shared histories, cultures, and achievements, and to explore how each of us can contribute to achieving reconciliation in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 2023 Statehood Day of Croatia
item.description:
Tuesday, May 30, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to recognise 2023 Statehood Day of Croatia.

With more than 50,000 Croatians live in Queensland and we would like to take this opportunity to mark the Statehood Day of Croatia which is on May 30.

This Light Up is organised by: Consulate General of The Republic of Croatia

Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

City Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to recognise 2023 Statehood Day of Croatia.
With more than 50,000 Croatians live in Queensland and we would like to take this opportunity to mark the Statehood Day of Croatia which is on May 30.
This Light Up is organised by: Consulate General of The Republic of Croatia

item.title: Darkness to Daylight 100km overnight run
item.description:
Tuesday, May 30, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support Darkness to Daylight 100km overnight run.

The Darkness to Daylight event is Challenge DV's flagship fundraising and awareness event which consists of a 110km overnight run, 110km monthly running challenge, and a 10km and 3km community mass-participation event. The event raised $420000 in 2022 and aims to do even better in 2023.

This Light Up is organised by: Challenge DV

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: World MS Day
item.description:
Tuesday, May 30, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red to support World MS Day.

Each year on 30 May we celebrate the World MS day with different themes each year, chosen by Multiple Sclerosis International Federation. Around the globe MS communities raise awareness, share stories and campaign with and for everyone affected by multiple sclerosis. It is a day where we celebrate global solidarity and hope for the future.

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: State of Origin Game I
item.description:
Wednesday, May 31, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Maroon to support State of Origin Game I.

The Queensland Maroons won the bragging rights to last year's State of Origin by winning the Game I at Accor Stadium and Game III at Suncorp. The New South Wales Blues convincingly won Game II at Optus Stadium in Perth.  Adelaide Oval is hosting Game I, 2023 as we watch with anticipation to see who will secure the early lead. We know who we are backing! You've got this Queensland!

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate
